description: From French mignonnette, from mignon (“dainty”) + -ette (“diminutive suffix”).

adjectives.description: mignonette (comparative more mignonette, superlative most mignonette)

entries.meaning: Of a greyish-green colour, like that of the flowers of the plant.
examples: She wore a dishabille of mignonette-green silk and bead-diapered head-dress that added several inches to her height […].

entries.meaning: A plant, Reseda odorata, having greyish-green flowers with orange-coloured stamens, and exhaling a delicious fragrance. In Africa it is a low shrub, but further north it is usually an annual herb. [from early 18th c.]
A mignonette tree (Lawsonia inermis), source of the dye henna.
A greyish-green colour, like that of the flowers of the plant.
